Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.model

Class GodsRules

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.model.GodsRules
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRules, IStateManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
Apollo, Artemis, Athena, Atlas, Demeter, Hephaestus, Hera, Hestia, Limus, Minotaur, Pan, Prometheus, Triton, Zeus
public class GodsRules
extends Object
implements IRules, IStateManager
Contains the god specific rules, decorating the main core: DefaultRules.

    • executeState

      public boolean executeState​(TurnPhase currentPhase, Worker worker, Tile tile, boolean choice)
      Description copied from interface: IStateManager
      Executes and manages the current phase actions.
      Specified by:
      executeState in interface IStateManager
      Parameters:
      currentPhase - Actual phase at the given moment.
      worker - Worker who performs actions during the current phase.
      tile - Tile destination of an action.
      choice - Boolean that sets the possible power choice.
      Returns:
      true if the current phase is executed normally, false if there are problems that prevent the normal execution to complete.

    • validMoveRecursive

      protected final boolean validMoveRecursive​(Worker worker, Tile destinationTile)
      Checks if a given move action is permitted for the worker, checking if there are any restrictions or wider allowances due to all the gods powers implicated in the current game.
      Parameters:
      worker - Reference to the worker to be moved
      destinationTile - Reference to the destination tile.
      Returns:
      true if move is valid, false otherwise.

    • checkMoveLost

      public final boolean checkMoveLost​(Player player)
      Description copied from interface: IRules
      Method checks if there are any possible moves for a given player, checking both workers.
      Specified by:
      checkMoveLost in interface IRules
      Parameters:
      player - Reference to the player checked.
      Returns:
      true if there are no moves left so that the player lost, false if the player can keep playing, as at least there is one possible move left.
